about_the_game:
Catch the Y2K Bug:

It’s New Year’s in the new millennium and someone forgot to update the office computers, unleashing an unstoppable bug. You play the part of a power hungry computer, armed with the most advanced arsenal…of floppy disks and keyboards. Hit the mall, pop into a laundromat, and stop by your neighborhood video store as you navigate throwback maps and use fun power-ups in the fight of your life.

FEATURES

Multiplayer Mayhem:

Compete from your couch with 4-player local multiplayer or play online with this cool new cutting edge tech called the “world wide web.” Challenge yourself with four different game modes: Brawler, Capture the Plug, Cyber Blitz, and Blackout.

Cable Management:

Power cables will only get you so far before you reach their limit. Unplug and find a new outlet when you need some juice. Move and maneuver, but watch that power cord – you don't want to get unplugged!

Power to the Outlet:

When you plug into an outlet, you pull energy from the room around you, changing the map as you play. Keep your power level in mind as you attack and retreat, and don’t forget to defend your outlet!

Feng Shui your way:

Is that pesky office chair in the way? Hate taking calls at your desk? Whack your problems away with your keyboard and let physics do the rest. Turn obstacles into opportunities and reshape your digital battleground!

ext_user_account_notice: Epic Online Services (Supports Linking to Steam Account)
name: Ctrl+Alt+Destroy

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 x64bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4570
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GTX 650
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 x64bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-13700K
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia RTX 2060
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

short_description: The year 2000 is right around the corner. Do you think your CPU can survive Y2K?
